Key Match Events: Chris Finch's veterans, particularly in the first three quarters, carried the team.
Rob Dillingham scattered seven points to help the Timberwolves take a 58-49 lead.
Dalton Knecht showed why he was a first-round pick in this year's draft.
Bronny James had a so-so performance but competed during his six-minute stint in the second quarter.
Pre-Game Insights: The Minnesota Timberwolves and the LA Lakers opened their preseason campaigns against each other at the Acrisure Arena in Palm Desert, CA.
Superstars like LeBron James, Anthony Davis, Anthony Edwards and Julius Randle were unavailable.
Post-Match Reflections: Minnesota Timberwolves vs LA Lakers game player stats and box scores
The Timberwolves had a fast start behind Mike Conley, but careless turnovers slowed the Timberwolves down.
LA Lakers fans finally got what they wanted when Redick started Bronny James in the second quarter.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chris Finch kept his starters in for almost the entire first quarter, giving Donte DiVincenzo an extended run with his old reliables.
Max Christie had a strong start, leading the team with seven points before he was substituted.
Austin Reaves went 0-for-5, but hit two free throws.
Minnesota's second-stringers, composed mainly of veterans, kept the Lakers in check.
